availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James M. Smith (Rockcastle County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Rockcastle County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Ann Smith. Farmer in Rockcastle County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned six enslaved persons in Rockcastle County in 1850. Money shaver in Rockcastle County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Rockcastle County in 1860. Household owned an additional four enslaved persons in Rockcastle County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Northern District, p. 184A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Northern District.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Mount Vernon, p. 574.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, p. 205B.
